Class Hero

  • java.lang.Object
    • DungeonCharacter
      • Hero
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Sorceress, Thief, Warrior

    public abstract class Hero
extends DungeonCharacter
    Abstract base class for a hierarchy of heroes. It is derived from DungeonCharacter. A Hero has battle choices: regular attack and a special skill which is defined by the classes derived from Hero.

      • Hero

        public Hero(java.lang.String name,
            int hitPoints,
            int attackSpeed,
            double chanceToHit,
            int damageMin,
            int damageMax,
            double chanceToBlock)
        Full constructor for a Hero object
        Parameters:
        name - the hero name
        hitPoints - the number of hit points the hero has
        attackSpeed - the hero's attack speed
        chanceToHit - the hero's chance to land a hit
        damageMin - the hero's minimum damage
        damageMax - the hero's maximum damage
        chanceToBlock - the hero's chance to block an attack

    • Method Detail

      • defend

        public boolean defend()
        defend determines if hero blocks attack
        Returns:
        boolean True if they defended, False if not

      • subtractHitPoints

        public void subtractHitPoints(int hitPoints)
        subtractHitPoints checks to see if hero blocked attack, if so a message is displayed, otherwise base version of this method is invoked to perform the subtraction operation.
        Overrides:
        subtractHitPoints in class DungeonCharacter
        Parameters:
        hitPoints - the number of hit points to subtract

      • battleChoices

        public void battleChoices(DungeonCharacter opponent)
        Computes the number of turns a hero will get per round based on the opponent that is being fought. The number of turns is reported to the user.
        Parameters:
        opponent - the opponent the hero is fighting
